title:
Local times in critical generations of a random walk in random
  environment on trees
abstract:
We consider a null-recurrent randomly biased walk $\mathbb{X}$ on a
Galton-Watson tree in the (sub)-diffusive regime and we prove that properly
renormalized, the local time in a critical generation converges in law towards
some function of a stable continuous-state branching process. We also provide
an explicit equivalent of the probability that critical generations are reached
by the random walk $\mathbb{X}$.
